title: How to Make a Cinnamon Crumb Coffee Cake Using Baker Josef's Mix

steps.headline: Butter or lightly flour an  8-inch round cake pan or a 9" square or 9" round cake pan.
Open the box of cinnamon crumb coffee cake mix.
steps.description: There should be two packets in it. Choose the packet labeled "cake mix". (The words are typed and small, probably located at the bottom of the packet.)

steps.headline: Take the cake mix packet and pour it carefully into a mixing bowl.
Put in the milk or water, melted butter or vegetable oil, and egg.
Mix the ingredients together with a whisk or an electric mixer until combined.
steps.description: If you are using the electric mixer, use it for only fifteen seconds. Do not over mix.

steps.headline: Get another mixing bowl and pour in the crumb packet.
steps.description: Put in  unsalted butter cut into small pieces. Combine the mixture with either a fork, the whip of an electric mixer, or your finger tips to well incorporated.

steps.headline: Once that is complete, set it aside.
steps.description: There should be two choices on the box's instructions. You can have crumb in the middle, or all crumb on top. If you would like crumb in the middle, spread half of the batter in the prepared pan, and then put in half of the crumb mixture over the batter. Then, using a spoon, put in the rest of the batter. The rest of the crumb mixture will be sprinkled over top. If you prefer all crumb on top, spread all the batter into the prepared pan, making sure the whole thing is covered. Then, put all of the crumb mixture on top of the batter. If you are using the 9" pan, bake for 40 to 55 minutes. If you are using the 8" pan, bake for 45 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick or a sharp object comes out clean.

text: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Butter or lightly flour an  8-inch round cake pan or a 9" square or 9" round cake pan.  Open the box of cinnamon crumb coffee cake mix. There should be two packets in it. Choose the packet labeled "cake mix". (The words are typed and small, probably located at the bottom of the packet.) Take the cake mix packet and pour it carefully into a mixing bowl.  Put in the milk or water, melted butter or vegetable oil, and egg.  Mix the ingredients together with a whisk or an electric mixer until combined. If you are using the electric mixer, use it for only fifteen seconds. Do not over mix. Get another mixing bowl and pour in the crumb packet. Put in  unsalted butter cut into small pieces. Combine the mixture with either a fork, the whip of an electric mixer, or your finger tips to well incorporated. Once that is complete, set it aside. There should be two choices on the box's instructions. You can have crumb in the middle, or all crumb on top. If you would like crumb in the middle, spread half of the batter in the prepared pan, and then put in half of the crumb mixture over the batter. Then, using a spoon, put in the rest of the batter. The rest of the crumb mixture will be sprinkled over top. If you prefer all crumb on top, spread all the batter into the prepared pan, making sure the whole thing is covered. Then, put all of the crumb mixture on top of the batter. If you are using the 9" pan, bake for 40 to 55 minutes. If you are using the 8" pan, bake for 45 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick or a sharp object comes out clean. Finished.
